$MSFT I sold some puts earlier so the market could finally crash you're all welcome

Stocks in the Nasdaq 100 Index ($NDX) led the market lower as evidenced by Invesco’s index fund ($QQQ) shedding 2.5% today. The session marked the fourth consecutive lower close for major indexes.  
 
Though fears of inflation, war, and plague still linger in the minds of investors, no headlines encouraged prices to spike lower. Instead, sellers overwhelmed buyers today from the opening to the closing bell.  
 
The chart below shows that the two largest holdings in the Nasdaq index, Apple ($AAPL) and Microsoft ($MSFT), declined by the same amount as the index overall. This suggests an orderly and sustained sell-off as investors continue to trim risk. When added to the past several weeks, today’s drop puts the Nasdaq index into bear market territory since it has fallen more than 20% from its recent highs in December.
